intro: Xanthosia juncea, commonly known as the slender sandblow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that are clustered in a head, often surrounded by bracts. Xanthosia juncea is known for its hardy nature and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
